channel.title: [TUT]Password & Text Field. [HTML]
channel.description:
Ok, starting with the text.. In your body tags Add this in [code]
JUST-SOME-TEXT :

[/code] And just fill in whatever you want. To make a password textspot where it says " [/code] the first part is just saying its a form the name part is just giving it a name not realy needed the action is were it will send the info after some one has hit the submit button the method is post witch well go read my or sppt's tut [code]
[/code] this is just saying whether you want it to be on the right left or center of the page left is not needed as its default nether is the div tag [code] JUST-SOME-TEXT : [/code] the JUST-SOME-TEXT : will be a sentence saying just some words before the test box the test box uses the imput tag the type will be a text field there should be a name there to call on it later. [code]

[/code] is just to brakes in the page like to enters there also should be this in there seen as she (he i meant 0.o sorry) says user name and password [code] [/code] there you go cabby just quote this and edit your first post to put it in.:)[br][size=1]Posted on: April 02, 2007, 11:25:04 AM[/size][hr]oh and lul if you want a easy basic pass php file use some thing like this[php] [/php] some crap like that im off before i dry up into dust[/quote]

item.title: [TUT]Password & Text Field. [HTML]
item.dc:creator: @XxKanexX Kane.
item.description:
@XxKanexX wrote:

[quote=“Cabby, post:7, topic:73451”][quote author=N00b1 link=topic=107927.msg1081402#msg1081402 date=1175553096]

<form name="YOUR_FORM_NAME" action="URL-TO-GO-TO-IF-YOU-ADD-BUTTON" method="POST">

the first part is just saying its a form the name part is just giving it a name not realy needed the action is were it will send the info after some one has hit the submit button the method is post witch well go read my or sppt’s tut

 <div align="CENTER; LEFT; RIGHT">

this is just saying whether you want it to be on the right left or center of the page left is not needed as its default nether is the div tag

JUST-SOME-TEXT : <input type="text" size="25">

the JUST-SOME-TEXT : will be a sentence saying just some words before the test box
the test box uses the imput tag the type will be a text field there should be a name there to call on it later.

<br><br>

is just to brakes in the page like to enters

there also should be this in there seen as she (he i meant 0.o sorry) says user name and password

<input type="password" name="pass" size="25"/>

there you go cabby just quote this and edit your first post to put it in.:)[br][size=1]Posted on: April 02, 2007, 11:25:04 AM[/size][hr]oh and lul if you want a easy basic pass php file use some thing like this[php]

<?php $username = $_POST['username']; $pass = $_POST['pass']; $adminu = 'myuser'; $adminpass = 'lul'; if ($username == $adminu) { } else { echo 'lul you n00b i got a l33t hack system'; } if ($pass == $adminpass) { redirect to page must have some code that i cant be botherd to make ontop because its like 40 degrees and im sweating and going out now } else { echo 'lul you n00b i got a l33t hack system'; } ?>[/php]

some crap like that im off before i dry up into dust
[/quote]

I know all of that. And I’m tired of you posting on all of my tutorials fucking flaming them. so STOP!

Lol nice tut n00b1, Thats better than the actual one. Except its in php as well. But nice try cabby.

GTFO, You a noob web developer. You know nothing. So just leave while your at it.[/quote]
He wasn’t flaming them. No offense, but you just put some code there… Wow, great tutorial. /sarcasm.

Noob1 described it and took it a bit further with the PHP coding as well. Can’t really do much with just a form and a textbox.

Read full topic

item.title: [TUT]Password & Text Field. [HTML]
item.dc:creator: @Cabby Cabby
item.description:
@Cabby wrote:

Ok, starting with the text… In your body tags Add this in

[code]

JUST-SOME-TEXT :

[/code]

And just fill in whatever you want.
To make a password textspot where it says “<input type"text”" change “text” to password.
Example:
http://www.rsaddict.com/examples/form.html
My div align is left.

[center]N00b1’s Helpful Hints[/center]

[quote=“N00b1”][code]

[/code] the first part is just saying its a form the name part is just giving it a name not realy needed the action is were it will send the info after some one has hit the submit button the method is post witch well go read my or sppt's tut 
 <div align="CENTER; LEFT; RIGHT">

this is just saying whether you want it to be on the right left or center of the page left is not needed as its default nether is the div tag

JUST-SOME-TEXT : <input type="text" size="25">

the JUST-SOME-TEXT : will be a sentence saying just some words before the test box
the test box uses the imput tag the type will be a text field there should be a name there to call on it later.

<br><br>

is just to brakes in the page like to enters

there also should be this in there seen as she (he i meant 0.o sorry) says user name and password

<input type="password" name="pass" size="25"/>

there you go cabby just quote this and edit your first post to put it in.:)[br][size=1]Posted on: April 02, 2007, 11:25:04 AM[/size][hr]oh and lul if you want a easy basic pass php file use some thing like this[php]

<?php $username = $_POST['username']; $pass = $_POST['pass']; $adminu = 'myuser'; $adminpass = 'lul'; if ($username == $adminu) { } else { echo 'lul you n00b i got a l33t hack system'; } if ($pass == $adminpass) { redirect to page must have some code that i cant be botherd to make ontop because its like 40 degrees and im sweating and going out now } else { echo 'lul you n00b i got a l33t hack system'; } ?>[/php]

some crap like that im off before i dry up into dust[/quote]
